articles.description: As Liverpool prepare for a new-look full-back pairing this season, BBC Sport look at the end of an era for Trent Alexander-Arnold and Andy Robertson.
articles.title: Trent Alexander-Arnold and Andy Robertson: End of one of the great full-back duos

articles.description: Jofra Archer was like a "£100m signing" in 2019 but, after the heartache of persistent injuries, how will he fare on his Test comeback?
articles.title: Jofra Archer: How England bowler made his return to Test cricket

articles.description: Cristiano Ronaldo has signed a new two-year deal with Saudi Pro League club Al-Nassr.
articles.title: Cristiano Ronaldo new contract: Portugal captain signs Al-Nassr deal until 2027

articles.description: Britain's Oliver Tarvet reaches the Wimbledon singles main draw - which will contain the highest number of home players for 41 years.
articles.title: Wimbledon 2025 qualifying: British world number 719 Oliver Tarvet reaches main draw

articles.description: Champion jockey Oisin Murphy is charged with drink driving and failing to co-operate with police after a car crash in April.
articles.title: Oisin Murphy charged with drink driving after car crash

articles.description: Arsenal have opened talks with Spanish club Valencia as the Premier League club look to sign 20-year-old defender Cristhian Mosquera.
articles.title: Arsenal transfer news: Gunners in talks to sign Valencia defender Cristhian Mosquera

articles.description: Lions captain Dan Sheehan says Western Force can not have monopoly on passion in Saturday's first match on Australia soil
articles.title: British and Irish Lions: Dan Sheehan challenges Lions to match hosts' passion

articles.description: Liverpool take their summer spending to about £170m with the signing of left-back Milos Kerkez from Bournemouth in a deal worth £40m.
articles.title: Milos Kerkez: Who is 'brilliant' left-back joining Liverpool from Bournemouth for £40m?

articles.description: Kirsty Coventry, the new president of the International Olympic Committee (IOC), says its members have shown "overwhelming support" to protecting the female category in sport.
articles.title: Kirsty Coventry: IOC president says female category has to be protected

articles.description: Uefa executives will meet on Friday to decide whether Crystal Palace will be allowed to play in next season's Europa League.
articles.title: Crystal Palace: Uefa to decide Eagles' Europa League fate on Friday
